paper_abstract: Horcik and Terui [8] show that, if a substructural logic enjoys the disjunction property, then its tautology problem is PSPACE-hard. We prove that all substructural logics in the interval between intuitionistic logic and generalized Hajek basic logic have a PSPACE-hard tautology problem, which implies that uncountably many substructural logics lacking the disjunction Property have a PSPACE-hard tautology problem. paper_title: Polynomial space hardness without disjunction property
